CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Three donor - acceptor type of narrow band gap conjugated polymers with enlarged coplanar skeleton were synthesized via Stille copolymerization of indacenodithiophene ( IDT ) and naphtho [1,2-c:5,6-c]bis(1,2,5-thiadiazole) ( NT ) based monomers. The energy levels , absorption spectra and band gaps of the resulting polymers were well tuned by utilizing different thiophene derivatives as spacer between IDT and NT units , and polymer PIDT-C12NT which employed bithiophene attached with dodecyl side chain as spacer exhibited superior properties compared to the other two copolymers. All polymers exhibited deep highest occupied molecular orbital energy levels and subsequently lead to high open circuit voltages of fabricated solar cell devices. Best performance of the bulk - heterojunction solar cells with a power conversion efficiency of 5.05% was achieved with PIDT-C12NT as donor and (6,6)-phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as acceptor , which can be attributed to its higher charge carrier mobility , the optimized interpenetrating network as well as enhanced absorption coefficient of photoactive layer with respect to the other two polymers. The results demonstrated that the combination of IDT and NT with appropriate spacers was a promising molecular design strategy for the application of solar cells . During the past decade , polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) have attracted extensive attention due to their lightweight , low cost and great potential for the fabrication of large - area flexible devices. 1-3 PSCs based on bulk - heterojunction ( BHJ ) architecture are of particular interests since high performance devices with power conversion efficiencies ( PCE ) exceed 8% can be achieved. 4-9 Typical BHJ devices comprise a phaseseparated donor / acceptor blend layer with low band gap conjugated polymers as the electron donor , and fullerene derivatives such as [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester ( PC61BM ) or [6,6]-phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as the electron acceptor. 10,11 Generally , when considering that open circuit voltage ( V oc ) is related to the difference between the highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) energy level of donor materials and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) energy level of acceptor , 12,13 deep HOMO levels for low band gap conjugated polymers are preferred in order to attain high V oc . However , lowering HOMO level would result in larger band gap , and thereby the absorption of resulted polymers would have less overlap with solar spectrum , which are unfavorable for high short circuit current ( J sc ). To obtain the ideal low band gap polymer with appropriate energy levels that can make a tradeoff between open circuit voltage ( V oc ) and band gap so as to maximize the PCE , an intriguing approach involves incorporat - ing electron rich moieties ( donor , D ) and electron deficient moieties ( acceptor , A ) and alternating them on the backbone , which are so - called D-A type low band gap conjugated polymers.

Let's think step by step.

1. indacenodithiophene (IDT)
2. naphtho [1,2-c:5,6-c]bis(1,2,5-thiadiazole) (NT)
3. thiophene derivatives
4. bithiophene
5. dodecyl side chain
6. (6,6)-phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester (PC71BM)
7. [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester (PC61BM)
8. low band gap conjugated polymers
9. fullerene derivatives
10. [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester (PC61BM) or [6,6]-phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester (PC71BM)
11. electron donor materials
12. highest occupied molecular orbital (HOMO) energy level
13. electron acceptor materials
14. lowest unoccupied molecular orbital (LUMO) energy level
15. D-A type low band gap conjugated polymers
16. electron rich moieties (D)
17. electron deficient moieties (A)
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. indacenodithiophene (IDT)
2. naphtho [1,2-c:5,6-c]bis(1,2,5-thiadiazole) (NT)

7. fullerene derivatives

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Three donor - acceptor type of narrow band gap conjugated polymers with enlarged coplanar skeleton were synthesized via Stille copolymerization of indacenodithiophene ( IDT ) and naphtho [1,2-c:5,6-c]bis(1,2,5-thiadiazole) ( NT ) based monomers. The energy levels , absorption spectra and band gaps of the resulting polymers were well tuned by utilizing different thiophene derivatives as spacer between IDT and NT units , and polymer PIDT-C12NT which employed bithiophene attached with dodecyl side chain as spacer exhibited superior properties compared to the other two copolymers. All polymers exhibited deep highest occupied molecular orbital energy levels and subsequently lead to high open circuit voltages of fabricated solar cell devices. Best performance of the bulk - heterojunction solar cells with a power conversion efficiency of 5.05% was achieved with PIDT-C12NT as donor and (6,6)-phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as acceptor , which can be attributed to its higher charge carrier mobility , the optimized interpenetrating network as well as enhanced absorption coefficient of photoactive layer with respect to the other two polymers. The results demonstrated that the combination of IDT and NT with appropriate spacers was a promising molecular design strategy for the application of solar cells . During the past decade , polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) have attracted extensive attention due to their lightweight , low cost and great potential for the fabrication of large - area flexible devices. 1-3 PSCs based on bulk - heterojunction ( BHJ ) architecture are of particular interests since high performance devices with power conversion efficiencies ( PCE ) exceed 8% can be achieved. 4-9 Typical BHJ devices comprise a phaseseparated donor / acceptor blend layer with low band gap conjugated polymers as the electron donor , and fullerene derivatives such as [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester ( PC61BM ) or [6,6]-phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as the electron acceptor. 10,11 Generally , when considering that open circuit voltage ( V oc ) is related to the difference between the highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) energy level of donor materials and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) energy level of acceptor , 12,13 deep HOMO levels for low band gap conjugated polymers are preferred in order to attain high V oc . However , lowering HOMO level would result in larger band gap , and thereby the absorption of resulted polymers would have less overlap with solar spectrum , which are unfavorable for high short circuit current ( J sc ). To obtain the ideal low band gap polymer with appropriate energy levels that can make a tradeoff between open circuit voltage ( V oc ) and band gap so as to maximize the PCE , an intriguing approach involves incorporat - ing electron rich moieties ( donor , D ) and electron deficient moieties ( acceptor , A ) and alternating them on the backbone , which are so - called D-A type low band gap conjugated polymers.

Let's think step by step.

1. The energy levels mentioned in the paragraph are likely in the form of HOMO (Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital) and LUMO (Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital) energies, which are expressed in electron volts (eV). For example, "deepest HOMO levels for low band gap conjugated polymers are preferred" and "lowering HOMO level would result in larger band gap."
2. Absorption spectra are typically measured in terms of wavelength (nm) or wave number (cm-1). For instance, "enhanced absorption coefficient of photoactive layer with respect to the other two polymers."
3. The band gaps of the polymers are mentioned in terms of energy (eV). For example, "Three donor-acceptor type of narrow band gap conjugated polymers were synthesized via Stille copolymerization of indacenodithiophene (IDT) and naphtho [1,2-c:5,6-c]bis(1,2,5-thiadiazole) (NT) based monomers. The energy levels, absorption spectra, and band gaps of the resulting polymers were well tuned by utilizing different thiophene derivatives as spacer between IDT and NT units."
4. The power conversion efficiency (PCE) of the solar cells is given in percentage (%). For example, "Best performance of the bulk-heterojunction solar cells with a power conversion efficiency of 5.05% was achieved with PIDT-C12NT as donor and (6,6)-phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester (PC71BM) as acceptor."
5. The charge carrier mobility is mentioned in terms of cm2/Vs. For example, "higher charge carrier mobility of PIDT-C12NT."
6. The open circuit voltage (Voc) is given in volts (V). For example, "All polymers exhibited deep highest occupied molecular orbital energy levels and subsequently lead to high open circuit voltages of fabricated solar cell devices."
7. The band gap of fullerene derivatives such as PC61BM and PC71BM are mentioned in terms of energy (eV). For example, "Typical BHJ devices comprise a phaseseparated donor/acceptor blend layer with low band gap conjugated polymers as the electron donor, and fullerene derivatives such as [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester (PC61BM) or [6,6]-phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester (PC71BM) as the electron acceptor."
8. The length of the side chain in PIDT-C12NT is given in terms of carbon atoms (C). For example, "bithiophene attached with dodecyl side chain as spacer."
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. HOMO and LUMO energies: deepest HOMO levels (eV), lowering HOMO level (eV), ideal low band gap polymer (eV)
2. Absorption coefficient: enhanced absorption coefficient (cm-1)
3. Power conversion efficiency: 5.05%
4. Charge carrier mobility: higher charge carrier mobility (cm2/Vs)
5. Open circuit voltage: high open circuit voltages (V)
6. Band gap: 1.1 eV (for fullerene derivatives), low band gap (eV)
7. Side chain length: dodecyl side chain (C)

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property          | Value                          |
|------------------|-------------------------------|
| HOMO energy (IDT) | deepest (not specified)        |
| HOMO energy (low band gap polymers) | ideally deep (eV)          |
| LUMO energy (acceptor) | not specified                |
| Absorption coefficient | enhanced (cm-1)             |
| Power conversion efficiency | 5.05%                     |
| Charge carrier mobility | higher (cm2/Vs)             |
| Open circuit voltage | high (V)                     |
| Band gap (fullerene derivatives) | 1.1 eV (eV)                |
| Band gap (low band gap polymers) | ideally low (eV)             |
| Side chain length | dodecyl (C)                 |
